articles.title: Lamar ruled out; Ravens to roll with Rush again
articles.summary: The Ravens have ruled quarterback Lamar Jackson out for Sunday's game against the Rams, marking the second straight week he has missed.

articles.title: 49ers set to start QB Jones again; Pearsall out
articles.summary: Mac Jones is slated to start in place of the injured Brock Purdy on Sunday against the Bucs, while receiver Ricky Pearsall will miss his second straight game.

articles.title: QB Sanders to back up Gabriel against Steelers
articles.summary: Shedeur Sanders will be the backup quarterback to starter Dillon Gabriel on Sunday in the Browns' divisional road game against the Steelers, coach Kevin Stefanski announced Friday.

articles.title: Raiders' Bowers misses 2nd game with knee injury
articles.summary: Raiders tight end Brock Bowers (knee) will miss his second-straight game, as he has been ruled out of Sunday's matchup against the Tennessee Titans.

articles.title: Seahawks likely down 3 DBs on Sunday vs. Jags
articles.summary: The Seattle Seahawks' secondary hasn't been whole since the first drive of the season opener, and it will once again be undermanned when the Seahawks play the Jaguars in Jacksonville on Sunday.

articles.title: Saints' Young to debut, Kamara questionable
articles.summary: New Orleans Saints' DE Chase Young is set to make his season debut on Sunday versus the New England Patriots after a calf injury, whereas RB Alvin Kamara's ankle status remains questionable with no injury designation.

articles.title: Concussion protocol for Giants' Dart under review
articles.summary: The NFL and NFLPA are reviewing the concussion protocol used in the evaluation of New York Giants rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart during Thursday night's game against the Philadelphia Eagles.

articles.title: Cowboys' Sanders to have season-ending surgery
articles.summary: Cowboys running back Miles Sanders needs season-ending surgery on his left knee, executive vice president Stephen Jones said on 105.3 The Fan in Dallas on Friday.
